item.title: This is a map of every neighborhood I represent on the Denver...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

This is a map of every neighborhood I represent on the Denver School Board.

Last night I heard from hundreds of parents across the city, but mainly from the Southeast area of town.

Educators expressed how they did not feel safe in schools as their site was lacking in various areas and some educators said they want to be in school.

...

Some parents spoke from households where they openly admitted they could go to private schools or move their child out of DPS and we heard from single mothers that were in tears thinking on how they would get by.

At the end of the call I told them I have “48 hours to fight like hell for some sort of a solution or guidance.”

Many of them already told me if their schools aren’t open they will use their first amendment rights and protest at various schools (with masks). — If it comes to that I will be there listening to other parents who I may not have had the opportunity to speak with.

WHY WOULD I DO THAT? — That’s been the question I’ve been asked multiple times. Look at that map again, those are still my constituents. As their At-Large School Board Director I don’t have the privilege of zoning in on one area over another.

To hear a wide range of voices I have set up town halls for NE/FNE Parents on Friday night and SW/W Parents on Saturday morning with the proper interpretation.

Insulting my intelligence or my ability to make decisions is disgusting. I was an advocate for remote learning and that has not miraculously disappeared over one call, but I have heard valid concerns and I have a duty to at least find an answer for those folks that attended.

I can assure you that as a Black School Board Director, I am capable of making pragmatic decisions and can find ways to listen to my constituents.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I want parents to know that I share your concerns and anger...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I want parents to know that I share your concerns and anger finding out district plans via the media and not from Denver Public Schools.

I actually read a Chalkbeat Colorado article about it before anyone from the district notified me.

We will fix this broken line of communication.

item.title: Denver Public Schools has called a REMOTE LEARNING DAY due to...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Denver Public Schools has called a REMOTE LEARNING DAY due to weather conditions.

What does this mean?

⁃ ALL students that have access to chrome books will be required to log on for a “normal” remote day.

...

⁃ If you do NOT have access to a chrome book your attendance will be excused.

⁃ ECE is CANCELLED

Our teams are still following the guidance of public health officials in Denver to make proper calls around our response to COVID-19.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: If it were up to me and me alone ALL schools in Denver would be...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

If it were up to me and me alone ALL schools in Denver would be remote, but our teams have been working with public health officials to make these calls on how and when students should return to school.

I will say I understand the impact this long closure has on children, especially children of color.

Opening schools in a pandemic isn’t a one size fits all solution, that is why I support a hybrid model and respecting a parents right to decide what’s best for their child.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Why the “Raven?” Here is from the administration at South...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Why the “Raven?”

Here is from the administration at South High:

We believe that the Ravens represent the South community in a number of ways. Ravens are smart, clever birds that are known to be strategic problem solvers. They are empathetic, loyal creatures that form lifelong bonds. And importantly, the raven is an inclusive animal -- it has a long history of being held in high regard both in Native American culture and others throughout the world, and ravens are not associated with any particular gender or race.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: BREAKING: Denver South High School has officially retired their...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

BREAKING:

Denver South High School has officially retired their rebel mascot which for centuries honored the confederacy and have announced their new mascot will be the Ravens!

As we enter a new era of Denver Public Schools let’s welcome the South High Ravens to #TeamDPS

item.title: “When I think of our DPS Mount Rushmore, I think of each and...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

“When I think of our DPS Mount Rushmore, I think of each and every one of your faces, because you have changed the landscape of what it means to be a DPS scholar.”

The historic Know Justice Know Peace Resolution comes after over a year of work led by Denver Public Schools students, teachers and staff at Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Early College

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways — I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences — I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
